abstract: The extended file attributes synced by the File Provider extension.
overview:
## Discussion

The extended file attributes are part of the item’s metadata. The system sets extended attributes on dataless files, and preserves them on files that it renders dataless. The system decides which attributes to sync. To sync an attribute, it calls the `xattr_name_with_flags(_:_:)` method and passes the `XATTR_FLAG_SYNCABLE` flag. Some older attributes are also synced.

The system caps the syncable extended attributes to about 32KiB  total for each item. If the extended attributes exceed this limit, the system automatically makes some of the attributes nonsyncable.

The system also decides which nonsyncable attributes it preserves on the local copy when a remote item changes. For example, it preserves attributes created by calling `xattr_name_with_flags(_:_:)` and passing `XATTR_FLAG_CONTENT_DEPENDENT` as long as the remote change didn’t modify the [doc://com.apple.fileprovider/documentation/FileProvider/NSFileProviderItemVersion/contentVersion] property for the item’s version.

This dictionary doesn’t list extended attributes that are already covered by [doc://com.apple.fileprovider/documentation/FileProvider/NSFileProviderItemFields] values, like [doc://com.apple.fileprovider/documentation/FileProvider/NSFileProviderItemFields/lastUsedDate] or [doc://com.apple.fileprovider/documentation/FileProvider/NSFileProviderItemFields/tagData]. Similarly, the dictionary doesn’t include the 32 bits of Finder info stored in an extended attribute named `com.apple.FinderInfo`, because this information exists in other [doc://com.apple.fileprovider/documentation/FileProvider/NSFileProviderItemProtocol] properties.

Also, the resource fork is content and isn’t included in the extended attributes dictionary. If your extension detects remote changes to the resource fork, report these changes by modifying the item version’s [doc://com.apple.fileprovider/documentation/FileProvider/NSFileProviderItemVersion/contentVersion] property.
rawMarkdown:
---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/FileProvider/NSFileProviderItemProtocol/extendedAttributes
crawled: 2025-12-07T23:17:46Z

# extendedAttributes

**Instance Property**

The extended file attributes synced by the File Provider extension.

## Declaration

```swift
optional var extendedAttributes: [String : Data] { get }
```

## Discussion

The extended file attributes are part of the item’s metadata. The system sets extended attributes on dataless files, and preserves them on files that it renders dataless. The system decides which attributes to sync. To sync an attribute, it calls the `xattr_name_with_flags(_:_:)` method and passes the `XATTR_FLAG_SYNCABLE` flag. Some older attributes are also synced.

The system caps the syncable extended attributes to about 32KiB  total for each item. If the extended attributes exceed this limit, the system automatically makes some of the attributes nonsyncable.

The system also decides which nonsyncable attributes it preserves on the local copy when a remote item changes. For example, it preserves attributes created by calling `xattr_name_with_flags(_:_:)` and passing `XATTR_FLAG_CONTENT_DEPENDENT` as long as the remote change didn’t modify the [doc://com.apple.fileprovider/documentation/FileProvider/NSFileProviderItemVersion/contentVersion] property for the item’s version.

This dictionary doesn’t list extended attributes that are already covered by [doc://com.apple.fileprovider/documentation/FileProvider/NSFileProviderItemFields] values, like [doc://com.apple.fileprovider/documentation/FileProvider/NSFileProviderItemFields/lastUsedDate] or [doc://com.apple.fileprovider/documentation/FileProvider/NSFileProviderItemFields/tagData]. Similarly, the dictionary doesn’t include the 32 bits of Finder info stored in an extended attribute named `com.apple.FinderInfo`, because this information exists in other [doc://com.apple.fileprovider/documentation/FileProvider/NSFileProviderItemProtocol] properties.

Also, the resource fork is content and isn’t included in the extended attributes dictionary. If your extension detects remote changes to the resource fork, report these changes by modifying the item version’s [doc://com.apple.fileprovider/documentation/FileProvider/NSFileProviderItemVersion/contentVersion] property.

## Managing Metadata

- **fileSystemFlags**: Flags that define an item’s on-disk properties and its appearance in the user interface.
- **NSFileProviderFileSystemFlags**: Flags that define an item’s on-disk properties and its appearance in the user interface.
- **tagData**: An abstract data blob representing the tags associated with the item.
- **userInfo**: A property list that contains additional data about the item.
- **favoriteRank**: A 64-bit, unsigned integer indicating the order of the favorite item in the Favorites list.
- **NSFileProviderFavoriteRankUnranked**: A value that indicates that the item is not ranked.
- **typeAndCreator**: The file type and creator codes for the item.
